alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clinton; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:56AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL BROWN, SOUTH CENTRAL CLINTON AND HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 AM EDT... At 1056 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lynchburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Lynchburg, Leesburg, Marshall, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Russell, New Market, St. Martin, Rocky Fork Lake, Danville in Highland County, Samantha, Rainsboro, Berrysville, State Route 136 at US Route 62, Highland County Airport and East Monroe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
